H0.text: Gametes are the cells that are not somatic cells, such as sperm or eggs.

H1.text: Spores are not somatic cells that come from the body, unlike sperm or eggs, which are gametes.

H2.text: Toxins are not somatic cells that come from the body, unlike sperm or eggs.

H3.text: Organic are cells that come from the body and are not what sperm or eggs are.

A4.text: In contrast to a gamete, which has only one set of chromosomes, a diploid somatic cell has two sets of homologous chromosomes, one of which is a copy of the chromosome set from the sperm and one a copy of the chromosome set from the egg cell.
